types.description: IIO based gyroscope input node. As any IIO device, it can use a buffer to get the readings. To use a buffer, define a size > 0 on buffer size. Readings are sent to the buffer via a trigger mechanism. Set iio_trigger_name to a valid iio trigger name in order to use buffer. If buffer is enabled but no iio_trigger_name was set, it will attempt to create a default trigger that will be activated when sending packets to TICK port.

in_ports.description: Packets sent in here will trigger a gyroscope reading and produce packets on each of the the output ports. If buffer is enabled, current trigger must accept manual activation (default one, sysfs trigger, does).
in_ports.name: TICK

types.name: iio/gyroscope

members.description: IIO device identifier. It's a space separated list of commands. For commands, if it's an integer value, will be interpreted as IIO device id. If it's a string starting with '/', will be interpreted as absolute path of IIO device on sysfs. If it's on the form 'i2c/X-YYYY', will evaluate to an i2c device on sysfs, where X is the bus number and YYYY is the device number, eg, 7-0069, for device 0x69 on bus 7. If it's on the form 'create,i2c,<rel_path>,<devnumber>,<devname>', where rel_path is the path of bus relative to '/sys/devices', them it will attempt to create an IIO device on that i2c bus and use it.
members.name: iio_device

members.description: IIO buffer size. If -1, buffering is disabled. If 0, will use default buffer size. If enabled (> 0), a trigger is necessary to perform readings. Set it using 'iio_trigger_name'; if no trigger name is set, it will attempt to create a default one, which is activated via TICK port.
members.name: buffer_size

members.description: IIO trigger name. Name of IIO trigger that should be associated to this device for buffered readings. If not set and buffer enabled, will try to use device current trigger, if any. If none, will attempt to create a sysfs trigger
members.name: iio_trigger_name

members.description: If should use device own default scale. If false, it will attempt to use scale option.
members.name: use_device_default_scale

members.description: Scale to applied to device raw readings
members.name: scale

members.description: If should use device own default offset. If false, it will attempt to use offset_x, offset_y and offset_z options.
members.name: use_device_default_offset

members.description: Offset to be added to device raw readings
members.name: offset

members.description: Sampling frequency of the sensor. If -1, use device default
members.name: sampling_frequency

out_ports.description: Angular speed in all X/Y/Z axes, in radians per second.
out_ports.name: OUT
